newsitem.title: USA: Limited to close 200 stores in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Limited to close 200 stores in 1997.

text.p: Limited Inc. said Monday it plans to close 200 underperforming stores in 1997 and also announced a series of management changes among its various clothing stores.

Limited operates Express, Lerner New York, Lane Bryant, Limited Stores, Henri Bendel, Structure, Limited too and Galyan's for a total of about 3,950 stores. It also operates more than 1,600 stores in its Intimate Brands division and 128 Abercrombie & Fitch stores.
Michael Weiss, who has been vice chairman of Limited, will again be president and chief executive of the Express chain of stores, where he served from 1982 to 1993.
Weiss succeeds Susan Falk, who resigned, the company said.

"Michael Weiss and I have agreed to this radical change in order to succeed in returning Express to its historical levels of profitability," Limited Chairman and Chief Executive Leslie Wexner said in a statement.
The company also named Barry Erdos chief financial officer of Express. Most recently, Erdos was chief financial officer of the Lane Bryant stores.
Limited stock was down 12.5 cents to close at $16.875 on the New York Stock Exchange.
